metadata.title: Convert PSI to Atmospheres – Pressure Converter
metadata.description: Convert pressure from PSI (Pounds per Square Inch) to Atmospheres (atm), useful for scientific pressure measurements.

introduction: This converter transforms pressure measurements from PSI to Atmospheres, enabling scientific pressure interpretation.
Scientific work and diving use atmospheres while practical equipment uses PSI.
This converter uses the standard relationship where 1 atmosphere equals approximately 14.696 PSI.
methodology: 1 atm ≈ 14.696 PSI. To convert PSI to atmospheres, divide by 14.696. For example, 14.696 PSI ≈ 1 atm, 147 PSI ≈ 10 atm.
Diving depth calculations use atmospheres while equipment pressure ratings use PSI.
Understanding pressure in consistent units is critical for safety in diving and pressure systems.
This converter provides precise pressure conversions.
examples: Example 1 – Diving: A depth with 30 PSI pressure is 30 ÷ 14.696 ≈ 2.04 atmospheres.
Example 2 – Equipment: A 100 PSI tank is approximately 6.8 atmospheres.
Example 3 – Safety: A system rated for 5 atmospheres can handle 73.5 PSI.

faqs.question: What is the conversion from PSI to Atmospheres?
faqs.answer: 1 atm ≈ 14.696 PSI. Divide PSI by 14.696 to get atmospheres.

faqs.question: What is the pressure at diving depths?
faqs.answer: 10 meters = ~2 atmospheres. 20 meters = ~3 atmospheres. 40 meters = ~5 atmospheres.

faqs.question: What is absolute pressure at sea level?
faqs.answer: 1 atmosphere absolute pressure = 14.696 PSI gauge = 0 PSI gauge at sea level.

glossary.definition: Pounds per Square Inch, imperial unit of pressure.
Pressure unit based on standard sea-level atmospheric pressure.
